text: Abdul Malik Fadjar (22 February 1939 - 7 September 2020) was an Indonesian politician and academic. He was the Minister of Religious Affairs between 1998 to 1999 and Minister of Education from 2001 to 2004. He worked during the cabinets of B. J. Habibie, Abdurrahman Wahid and Megawati Sukarnoputri. Fadjar died on 7 September 2020 at the age of 81. ==References== Category:1939 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Indonesian politicians Category:Indonesian academics
title: Abdul Malik Fadjar
